Package models

Class Ai

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.Player
      • models.Ai
  • public class Ai
extends Player
    Represents a player with built-in logic for playing moves, rather than one controlled by a human.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ai

        public Ai()
        Default constructor. Named "Player 2", with a black 'O' marker.

      • Ai

        public Ai​(javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
          java.lang.String name,
          MarkerShape shape)
        Parameterized constructor.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the AI's marker.
        name - The name displayed for the AI.
        shape - The shape of the AI's marker.

      • Ai

        public Ai​(Player player)
        Construct a new AI from a player object. The AI and the player will share a name, and will have the same marker (i.e. it's color and shape). They will not share an ID.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose properties should be copied over.

    • Method Detail

      • toPlayer

        public Player toPlayer()
        Constructs a new player object using the properties of the current AI. The player will be initialized with the same name and mark (i.e. color & shape) as the AI, as well as the same ID. This means that the AI and the created player object will be considered equivalent by program logic.

      • generateMove

        public org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> generateMove​(GameState gameState)
        Computes the AI's move given a particular game state.
        Parameters:
        gameState - Describes the current board state, and any rules governing the game.

      • findBestMove

        private org.javatuples.Triplet<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> findBestMove​(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode node,
                                                                                                               java.util.ArrayList<org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> emptyCells,
                                                                                                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> victoryArr,
                                                                                                               int gridSize)
        For a given set of available plays in a given board state, select the best possible play.
        Parameters:
        node - The node in the decision tree representing the most recent move.
        emptyCells - A list of empty cells on the board from which we are selecting the best possible play.
        victoryArr - A victory array representing the current progress towards victory on the board.
        gridSize - The board's dimensions.
        Returns:
        A tuple representing the best possible play from among the options. The tuple's first and second values represent (respectively) the play's x- and y-coordinates on the grid, while the tuple's third value is the weight of the play.
